|rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = soldered |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad1ac = 1300 |nqam1 = |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = |rad2modif = PCIe |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = MediaTek;MT7615N;Broadcom ??; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = soldered |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== CPU and wireless chip IDs are obscured by heatsinks in the FCC internal photos. :(The 1.2GHz dual-core CPU may be a [[Broadcom#Northstar_Plus]] (BCM58622) ?? ) {{FCC ST|04/24/2018|indexme.}} *CPU: [[NXP]] [https://www.nxp.com/products/microcontrollers-and-processors/arm-based-processors-and-mcus/qoriq-layerscape-arm-processors/qoriq-layerscape-1024a-dual-core-communications-processor:LS1024A QorIQ LS1024A] @1.2GHz Dual-core (ARM Cortex-A9) SoC {{see also|Cisco RV340W|Synology RT1900ac}} Intended Use from FCC Test Report:
"Bitdefender BOX 2 Smart Home Hub is used as a security device for home LAN network.
It is placed between WAN and LAN networks. It checks all IP packets passing through it and
looks for malicious contents. It provides protection for wired and wireless LAN networks." ==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *[https://www.tomsguide.com/us/bitdefender-box,review-3766.html ''Bitdefender Box (2018)'' on '''TomsGuide'''] *[https://www.digitalcitizen.life/bitdefender-box-2-review ''Bitdefender Box 2 review'' on '''Digital Citizen'''] :Specifications from the review: :Specifications from the review *CPU: NXP LS1024A Dual-Core ARM (Cortex-A9) @1.2GHz *Memory: 1GB (DDR3L) DRAM *Storage: 8GB eMMC 5.1 MLC NAND, 4MB SPI Flash *Wi-Fi: [[MediaTek]] MT7615N (2x 3T3R) *Wi-Fi Segment: AC1900 (1300 + 600 Mbps) *Number of Antennas: 6; Range: 90 feet *Network: 2x Gigabit Ethernet Ports *Power: 12V/2A via barrel *Size: 7.0 x 4.5 x 4.5 inches *Weight: 966 grams [[Category:English Documentation]]
